dt: {bc}a written record containing regular entries of items or details
{bc}a book or system of public records
{bc}a roster of qualified or available individuals
{bc}a set of organ pipes of like quality {bc}{sx|stop||}
{bc}the range of a human voice or a musical instrument
{bc}a portion of such a range similarly produced or of the same quality
{bc}any of the varieties of a language that a speaker uses in a particular social context
{bc}a grille often with shutters for admitting heated air or for ventilation
{bc}an automatic device {a_link|registering} a number or a quantity
{bc}a condition of correct alignment or proper relative position
{bc}a device (as in a computer) for storing small amounts of data
{bc}one in which data can be both stored and operated on

et: Middle English {it}registre{/it}, from Anglo-French, from Medieval Latin {it}registrum{/it}, alteration of Late Latin {it}regesta{/it}, plural, register, from Latin, neuter plural of {it}regestus{/it}, past participle of {it}regerere{/it} to bring back, pile up, collect, from {it}re-{/it} + {it}gerere{/it} to bear
shortdef: a written record containing regular entries of items or details
a book or system of public records
a roster of qualified or available individuals

dt: {bc}to make or secure official entry of in a register
{bc}to enroll formally especially as a voter or student
{bc}to make or adjust so as to correspond exactly
{bc}to secure special protection for (a piece of mail) by prepayment of a fee
{bc}to enroll one's name in a register
{bc}to enroll one's name officially as a prerequisite for voting
{bc}to be in correct alignment or register

shortdef: to make or secure official entry of in a register
to enroll formally especially as a voter or student

dt: {bc}to register (someone or something) again {bc}to enroll or enter (someone or something) again in an official {d_link|register|register:1}

dt.t: {wi}reregistered{/wi} the car in her own name
… pressured the school board to spend $8,000 to {wi}reregister{/wi} all 9,000 students in the district.
When he discovered that Independent was a political party, he {wi}re-registered{/wi} [as a voter] with no affiliation.

aq.auth: Peter Slevin and Carol D. Leonnig

dt.t: … failed to {wi}re-register{/wi} with police each year as required by law …

utxt.t: … attributed the lack of [voter] {wi}reregistrations{/wi} to the fact that there aren't statewide contests happening in Colorado this year.

shortdef: to register (someone or something) again : to enroll or enter (someone or something) again in an official register
